headline.main: On Ill Health and Air Pollution

byline.original: By Alice Bredin; Alice Bredin is a freelance journalist who writes about health issues

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AT THE FAIRVIEW LAKE Y.M.C.A. camp near the Delaware Water Gap in rural New Jersey, children come from the New York suburbs for a few weeks of fresh air and exercise. They rise early to swim, ride horses, learn archery and play soccer and softball. The camp is many miles from any industry, and there might seem no healthier place for youths to spend a summer.

headline.main: Study Offers First Evidence That Cutting Cholesterol Levels Saves Lives

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A new study has provided the first evidence that lowering cholesterol levels saves lives in patients whose hearts are functioning normally.
docs.snippet: LEAD: A new study has provided the first evidence that lowering cholesterol levels saves lives in patients whose hearts are functioning normally.
